content: Can you compose a haiku poem that celebrates the beauty of spring while paying homage to Ikebana, the Japanese art of flower arrangement? Remember, your poem must follow the traditional 5-7-5 syllable structure and use words that invoke the essence of both springtime and Ikebana. To make it a bit more challenging, try incorporating a reference to the number of petals on a specific flower commonly used in Ikebana arrangements. Good luck!

Cherry blossoms bloom,  
Five petals grace the branch tips,  
Artful spring whispers.
